Description: Complete scarab, made of faience, no glaze preserved. The division between elytra and prothorax is indicated by an incised line that is not horizontally but in a zig-zag. The suture is shown by a single line as well. At the lower part of the back another line parallel to the perforation. On the left side one of the humeral callosities is shown by a triangle, not visible on the right side. Head was preserved, clypeus not visible anymore. The side shows two legs in relief. Underneath the base part. The seal at the base shows no circumferential line. Standing pharaoh with a crown, facing to the right, both arms parallel to the body, standing in front of an offering stand. Very weathered, description is based on the drawing of the object card. Perforated along its longitudinal side.
